bibl.title: A Triumphant Macedonian Horseman: Evidence of a Ptolemaic Victory Monument.
bibl.note: The type of the victorious Macedonian horseman, which is only preserved in form of terracotta statuettes, is very likely to be a representation of Ptolemy I. It is probably modelled on a victory monument erected in the time following the Syrian campaign of 312/11 B.C.
